# News comment title:
Pat Caddell on Hillary Clinton: ‘She Keeps Going Back to the Same Lies, and She Gets Away with It’

# Oldest comment (from the thread):
 ‘I used a classified server for classified documents,’
---What the hell is a "Classified Server"????

What I am waiting for the press to ask this liar is this ---- 
"How Did Sidney Blumenthal send  YOU emails that contained Top Secret Information,  and why didn't the FBI investigate that??"

# Most liked comment (from the thread):
 ‘I used a classified server for classified documents,’
---What the hell is a "Classified Server"????

What I am waiting for the press to ask this liar is this ---- 
"How Did Sidney Blumenthal send  YOU emails that contained Top Secret Information,  and why didn't the FBI investigate that??"

>>> COMMENT UNDER ANALYSIS<<<


The famous quotation, attributed to Lincoln but may not have been said by him, "You can fool all the people some of the time, and some of the people all the time, but you cannot fool all the people all the time," is more true than ever in the age of the Internet and Breitbart.
Of course, there are still a good amount of people you can fool all the time. They are called Democrats.

>>> END COMMENT <<<

# News comment title:
Charlotte Police Chief: Officers Found Handgun, Not A Book At Keith Lamont Scott Shooting Scene

# Oldest comment (from the thread):
A female family member said she was a witness. 

She claimed he had a book in his hand and she was screaming how he was "Murdered!" She streamed it out to Social Media creating the false narrative of the "Unarmed black man" shot down for "no reason."  

Just like the "Hands up, don't shoot" it's a fabrication.

# Most liked comment (from the thread):
A female family member said she was a witness. 

She claimed he had a book in his hand and she was screaming how he was "Murdered!" She streamed it out to Social Media creating the false narrative of the "Unarmed black man" shot down for "no reason."  

Just like the "Hands up, don't shoot" it's a fabrication.

>>> COMMENT UNDER ANALYSIS<<<


When you are dealing with the police and you are told to get out of the car, NEVER have anything in your hands! In the heat of the situation you are asking to get shot.
This is also the case when you are evacuating a building in an active shooter situation. You have your hands up in plain sight, nothing in them. This helps the police see you as "non-threat" and you don't get shot.

>>> END COMMENT <<<

# Oldest comment (from the thread):
Shows she favors communism over freedom

# Most liked comment (from the thread):
Shows she favors communism over freedom

>>> COMMENT UNDER ANALYSIS<<<


He felt the big threat was sabotage.
Sadly, two major warnings of the attack were ignored. The first was the USS Ward spotting and attacking a Japanese midget sub outside Pearl Harbor. As the captain of the Ward was a new guy (first command, assumed two days before the attack), the Navy response was to ask for confirmation.
Several minutes later, the radar station at Opana Point picked up a flight of aircraft coming from the north. They phoned the Information Center at Fort Shafter. The person there had not had any training other than a brief orientation in mid-November, and was only doing his second ever shift there. He had heard that a group of B-17s were flying in from the mainland, and assumed that Opana Point had picked them up. His response would haunt him the rest of his life - "Don't worry about it."
What also made matters worse was that there was no working together by the Army and the Navy. Each service was addressing each event on their own. The Army knew nothing about the Ward's submarine, and the Navy knew nothing about the Opana Point contact. Had there been a unified command in Hawaii, both reports would have arrived at the same place and roughly at the same time, and someone might have realized that something big was about to happen.

# News comment title:
Bizarre Spectacle as Russia

# Oldest comment (from the thread):
Probably borrowed it from China.

# Most liked comment (from the thread):
At least it wasn't a gay pride parade.

>>> COMMENT UNDER ANALYSIS<<<


Funny thing about that, KtT - a Soviet Guards Tank unit, who could have the pick of any tank available, chose the M4A3E8. Why? The M4A3E8 had better fire control (including better optics), a turret basket (very nice to keep the loader from being killed as he's trying to reload the gun), a roomier turret (better ergonomics and lower gun depression), as well as a FM radio (it was very rare that Soviet tanks had any radio at all, and FM is less likely to have reception issues with all that metal).
The T34 total production (of all models) during the war was 54,550. Of these, 44,900 were total losses (these figures, BTW, are from the Russians themselves). Strategically speaking, the T34 may have been the correct choice - but a lot of Red Army tankers ended up getting killed in their T34s.

>>> END COMMENT <<<
